title: 1500 followers problem! For my friend Xuming!

Point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the circumcenter. Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\overline{OE}\\perp \\overline{AC} \\ , \\ \\overline{OF}\\perp \\overline{AB}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" . If the ratio "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\dfrac{OE}{OF}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be expressed as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\dfrac{a}{\\sqrt{b-\\sqrt{b}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b \\in \\mathbb{Z}^+"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is square free, "}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \\displaystyle \\left \\lfloor\\frac{1500}{a+b} \\right \\rfloor"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We first construct segments "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline { OA } ,\overline { OB } ,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline { OC } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since O is the circumcenter, we know that these three segments have the same length, and triangles "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AOB, AOC,"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"BOC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are isosceles. Thus, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"E"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"F"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are bisectors of sides "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AB"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", respectively. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We then assign the measure of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle BAO"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and from here we angle-chase a little bit until we reach "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle ABO=72-\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle ABO=\angle BAO=\alpha =72-\alpha"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\alpha =36"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Thus, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle FAO=\alpha =36"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\angle OAE=81-\alpha =45"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" . 
"},{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/6Ltg62i6XN-brilliant01005.jpg?width=1200"}},{"type":"text","text":"
We then have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline { OF } =\overline { OA } \times \sin { 36 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\overline { OE } =\overline { OA } \times \sin { 45 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac { OE }{ OF } =\frac { \sin { 45 }  }{ \sin { 36 }  } =\frac { \frac { \sqrt { 2 }  }{ 2 }  }{ \frac { \sqrt { 10-2\sqrt { 5 }  }  }{ 4 }  } =\frac { 2 }{ \sqrt { 5-\sqrt { 5 }  }  } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\left\lfloor \frac { 1500 }{ 2+5 }  \right\rfloor =\boxed { 214 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method 1:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be orthocenter and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"HL \perp AB \ , \ HK \perp AC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are the isogonal conjugates of each other. By one of the properties of isogonal conjugates ,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"  \begin{aligned}{\dfrac{OE}{OF} = \dfrac{HL}{HK} \\ = \dfrac{2R\cos A \cos B}{2R\cos A \cos C} \\ = \dfrac{\cos B}{\cos C} \\ = \dfrac{\cos 45^\circ}{\cos 54^\circ} \\ = \dfrac{2}{\sqrt{5-\sqrt{5}}}}\end{aligned} \\ \Rightarrow a+b=2+5=7 \Rightarrow \left \lfloor \dfrac{1500}{7} \right \rfloor = \lfloor 214.28 \rfloor = \boxed{214}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Method 2:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"OE = \dfrac{1}{2}(BH) = \dfrac{2R\cos B}{2} \ , \ OF = \dfrac{1}{2}(CH) = \dfrac{2R \cos C}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Clearly , it follows that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{OE}{OF} = \dfrac{\cos B}{\cos C}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and compute the required quantities same as in method "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". :)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                            It is not true that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"OE/OF = HL/HK"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"; since you are dropping the perpendiculars from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", you have to do the same with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the foot of the perpendicular from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Q"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the foot of the perpendicular from "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AB"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"OP/OQ = HL/HK"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

                                            Did you construct "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"H"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for the fun of it? because it is really not necessary lol"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"btw as you have experienced, online resources even the likes of Wolfram may contain incorrect information. title: 150 Follower Problem!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/4761cceb7c.e443feda6a.4PJcJc.jpg?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
In the following set up the rope is pulled with a Velocity "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"V"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the block of mass "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"M"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" starts moving horizontally initially and then moves up. Let at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the block make an angle of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\phi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with the vertical. At "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t = t_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" the block makes an angle of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\theta"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with the vertical.Given it doesn't move upwards till "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" find the horizontal velocity at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t = t_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Details and Assumptions","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":":"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"V = 150 \text{ m/s}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"          "}]}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\theta = 30^{\circ}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Simply use virtual work method. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For any close system "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum { \vec { T } .\vec { V }  } =0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let the velocity of the block be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v_{0}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (in horizontal direction)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-TV+Tv_{0}cos(90-\theta)=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v_{0}=300 m/s"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

                                            I don't know its proof but for a closed system  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum { \vec { T } .\vec { V } } =0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  always holds and  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum { \vec { T } .\vec { A } } =0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" also holds but there are some situations in which the latter one does not holds. Watch "},{"type":"text","text":"this","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" video to know more about this.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/rrzc5CH78h-capture.PNG?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Basic Consideration","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":": "},{"type":"text","text":"Velocity along the string is the same everywhere.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let the required horizontal velocity be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{V}_{x}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ V }_{ x }\cos { { 60 }^{ \circ  } } =V"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", or "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ V }_{ x }=300\quad \text{m/s}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Considering H as the height of pulley, R the lenght of the rope and x the distance of the block to the vertical of the pulley, being R=R(t) , x=x(t) and H equal a constant.  Now we can write by Phytagoras "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"R^{2}=H^{2}+x^{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"   so derivating by t and after simplification we get"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"R\frac{dR}{dt} =x\frac{dx}{dt}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{R}{x} = \frac{1}{\cos \theta}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By substitution of given value we get the velocity of the block is twice of the rope"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This\quad figure\quad shows\quad the\quad position\quad of\quad the\quad block\quad after\quad a\\ neglegible\quad time\quad \Delta .\\ \\ Since\quad the\quad velocity\quad of\quad the\quad rope\quad is\quad V,\quad its\quad length\quad\\ on\quad the\quad left\quad  side\quad of\quad the\quad pulley\quad changes\quad by\quad \Delta .V\quad in\quad \Delta \quad time.\\ So\quad AB=\Delta .V\qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad  \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \left( 1 \right) \\ \\ AC\quad is\quad the\quad displacement\quad covered\quad in\quad \Delta \quad time\quad by\quad the\quad block.\\ \\ So,\quad AC=\Delta .U\quad (Where\quad U\quad is\quad the\quad velocity\quad of\quad the\quad block)\quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad  \quad \quad \quad \quad \left( 2 \right) \\ By\quad simple\quad trigo\quad we\quad can\quad see\quad that\quad AC=AB\csc { \theta  } \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \qquad \left( 3 \right) \\ \\ Using\quad \left( 1 \right) ,\left( 2 \right) \quad and\quad \left( 3 \right) ,\quad we\quad get\\ \Delta .U=\Delta .V\csc { \theta  } \\ So\quad U=V\csc { \theta  } \\ So\quad U=150\times 2=300"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/qGXFlW5emX-sgf.jpg?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We assume that the triangle BCD is isosceles. And angle BDC is 0 because the time is negligible, so ABC=BCD=90
